body_html:
Hi, @DeckerCHAN . numpy_input_fn API: y: numpy array object. None if absent.. It confirms that y cannot be a dictionary.

So if I understand correctly, the issue is a feature request, right? I can work on it, however, I don't know whether tensorflower approve it.

By the way, perhaps pandas_input_fn needs handle DataFrame for y as well.
body_text:
Hi, @DeckerCHAN . numpy_input_fn API: y: numpy array object. None if absent.. It confirms that y cannot be a dictionary.
So if I understand correctly, the issue is a feature request, right? I can work on it, however, I don't know whether tensorflower approve it.
By the way, perhaps pandas_input_fn needs handle DataFrame for y as well.
body:
Hi, @DeckerCHAN . [numpy_input_fn](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/estimator/inputs/numpy_input_fn) API: `y: numpy array object. None if absent.`. It confirms that `y` cannot be a dictionary. 

So if I understand correctly, the issue is a feature request, right? I can work on it, however, I don't know whether tensorflower approve it. 

By the way, perhaps `pandas_input_fn` needs handle DataFrame for y as well.
